commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Co-ordination Group for Biodiversity and Nature #E02210#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2210#Member#C#ENV.D.2-Working Group on Invasive Alien Species#Commission Expert Group on Strategic Coordination for the Marine Strategy Framework Directive #E02550#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2550#Observer#C#Technical subgroup Underwater Noise#Expert Group on the exchange of information on Best Available Techniques related to industrial emissions (IED Article 13 Forum)#E02611#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2611#Member#C
membership: IUCN, European Seas Environmental Cooperation (ESEC, 4 regional NGO networks joint platform), CCB is a ExCom member and chairs the ecosystem based management WG of the Baltic Sea fishery Advisory Council(BSAC), CCB is an observer in HELCOM and ICES. CCB regularly participates in meetings with NASCO. CCB holds the Chair in the Jastarnia Group (a WG of ASCOBANS)
goals__remit:
CCB is a network of national NGOs formed to organize cooperation among member organisations, and to via the international office staff represent all Baltic region grass root NGOs in international fora, to follow the development of processes and relevant environmental and marine policies on an EU level and act towards relevant bodies such as HELCOM, BSAC, EU Strategy for the Baltic Sea Region etc. 
 
CCBs aim is to promote a sustainable development and the protection and restoration of the Baltic Sea catchment, the Baltic Sea water status and marine life.
relevant_communication: Implementation of CFP and the multiannual management plan for Baltic Fish stocks; HELCOM BSAP implementation; implementation of MSFD Program of Measures: litter, biodiversity/fisheries, eutrophication. Creation of MPAs and harbour porpoise protection. Updating the EU eel recovery plan and information about eel in general. CCB is also engaged in cross border cooperations with Ukraine, Belarus and Russia
